text.title: part8_Wikinews interviews Rocky De La Fuente, U.S. Democratic Party presidential candidate

p.s: We spend an inordinate amount of time and money intervening in the affairs of other nations .

What if we were to redirect our efforts and capital toward improving vital issues at home ( i. e. , our homeless , our displaced veterans , illiteracy and poverty ( which continue to hover around 15 % ) , the availability of health care for every American , etc. ) ?

We could lead by example rather than try to convince the rest of the world why it should follow our model , and at the same time , we would be taking care of our citizens and restoring hope and dignity to their lives .

p.hi: If elected , what would constitute a successful presidency for you ?

text.p:
De La Fuente
: Simplistically , if I could make meaningful progress toward achieving the goals I just listed , I would have a successful presidency .

caption.s: " I do n't need to serve in a political office to be happy , but I would be honored to do so if I thought I could give something back to my country .

p.hi: Which individuals would you like to see in a De La Fuente administration ?

text.p:
De La Fuente
: I would take a fundamentally different approach to staffing the De La Fuente administration .
Currently , over 80 percent of the senior White House staff positions and approximately 50 percent of the ambassadorships have gone to individuals who bundled $ 500 thousand or more for the current Administration .
While these people should n't be banned from serving the Administration if they are qualified , the disproportionate distribution suggests that the positions are more likely to be a repayment of political debt .
I will not do that .

p.s: I learned in business that I did best when I hired people who were better than me at what they did .
I did n't hire them to be subservient to me nor did I hire them because they were friends .
I think that same approach is needed in Washington , D.C. During these difficult times , we need our nation 's best and brightest individuals to tackle our problems .
I would select people to serve in my administration on a basis of merit .

p.hi: Do you plan on ever running for political office again ?

text.p:
De La Fuente
: I 'm a first generation
American who is extreme[ly ] proud of being a citizen of this great country .
To give you some perspective , I once wanted to fly a large
American flag
over one of my car dealerships , but the city 's governing body emphatically said , " No !
"
For nine years , I fought back before winning the right to honor our country with what has become a prominent landmark ; a 3,000
square foot
flag flying from the tallest free standing flag pole in the United States .

p.s: I do n't need to serve in a political office to be happy , but I would be honored to do so if I thought I could give something back to my country .
